comments:
Using build I200405190010:

Don't know the cause, but all of a sudden I couldn't invoke the call hierarchy 
on a method. I had the following call stack in the log. Restarting Eclipse 
cleared up the problem.

Hi Adrian,

Have you been able to reproduce with M9? If you have, could you please try to
describe steps to reproduce the error.
The NPE is in Platform/UI code. Moving...

To reproduce this:

1. Close all perspectives except one
2. Open the call hierarchy view. Drag it onto a stack by itself, then back onto
a stack with some other views (this ensures that it will appear last in
workbench.xml and won't be eagerly loaded).
3. Select another view, such that the hierarchy view is hidden.
4. Shut down and restart eclipse. (Make sure that the hierarchy view is still
hidden when you restart).
5. Maximize an editor.
6. Activate the hierarchy view using the keyboard shortcut (ctrl-alt-h)

Using the build on the 19th, this generates the stack trace above.

Using the same workspace and steps, I cannot reproduce this using M9.

The most likely explanation is that the control's widgetry had not been created
by the time partChangeAffectsZoom was called, resulting in a NPE when
getWindow() returned null. I believe that this was fixed by Nick's change in bug
61545.
